reviewText: It takes a while for the full scope of the mother - son relationship to open up and for the roles of the older brother and father to fill in. I will definitely watch this a few more times to see if I understand it. I did think some of the content was unnecessarily extreme and overdone. By that I mean the boy's vandalism was excessive and not very realistic in consequences.

A suicidal self destructive 10 year old would hardly seem like the stuff of comedy but this surprising film manages to bring it off while still conveying the underlying sadness and desperation of the principal character.
The movie was in excellent shape
Nice little coming-of-age movie with good emotional scenes and terrific acting. Highly recommended.

This film is very well done and moving, but it shows a lot of unhappiness and disfunction, as well as 2 suicide attemps and is not the kind of film to show in class, particularly to younger students.
